message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.MM

Reasoning: 
- cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely category as the paper deals with the broadcast rate and capacity of index coding problems, which are information-theoretic problems.
- cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) is also likely as index coding problems have applications in network coding and communication networks.
- cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is relevant as index coding problems can be used to model information dissemination in social networks.
- cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) is less likely but still possible as the paper discusses the construction of near-optimal vector linear index codes.
- cs.MM (Multimedia) is also less likely but possible as index coding problems have applications in multimedia communication and storage.
